gen_kg module

class gen_kg.API(baseURL)

Bases: object

Class for making API calls.

This class provides methods for making POST and GET requests to a specified base URL.

Parameters:

baseURL – The base URL for API requests.

get(route)

Send a GET request to the API, fetch data from the specified route, and return the JSON response.

Parameters:

route – The API route to retrieve data from.

Returns:

The JSON response from the GET request.

post(route, payload)

Send a POST request to the API and push the provided JSON payload to the specified route.

Parameters:

  • route – The API route to send the request to.

  • payload – JSON payload to send in the request.

class gen_kg.Detectron(pdf_path)

Bases: object

Class for working with the Detectron model for document layout analysis.

This class can be used to detect text and layout elements in a PDF document.

Parameters:

pdf_path – The path to the PDF document to analyze.

detect_and_draw_boxes(page_index=0)

Detect layout elements on the specified page and draw bounding boxes around them.

Parameters:

page_index – The index of the page to analyze, defaults to 0.

Returns:

The detected layout elements and an image with bounding boxes.

extract(detected, i=0)

Extract text, figures, and tables from the detected layout of the PDF document.

Parameters:

  • detected – The detected layout.

  • i – The index of the page to extract from, defaults to 0.

filter_non_english(text)

Filter non-English characters from the input text.

Parameters:

text – The input text.

Returns:

The filtered text with non-English characters removed.

class gen_kg.ERExtractor

Bases: object

key_value_pair_er_extractor(key_value_pairs)

Extract entity-relation data from a list of key-value pairs.

Args:

key_value_pairs (list of dict): A list of dictionaries containing key-value pairs.

Returns:

pandas.DataFrame: A DataFrame with columns ‘entity’, ‘relation’, and ‘object’ containing the extracted entity-relation data.

txt_er_extractor(txt)

Extract entity-relation data from a text using NLP processing.

Args:

txt (str): The input text for entity-relation extraction.

Returns:

pandas.DataFrame: A DataFrame with columns ‘id’, ‘text’, ‘entity’, ‘relation’, and ‘object’ containing the extracted entity-relation data.

class gen_kg.GraphPlotter(dtf, baseURL)

Bases: API

Class for plotting knowledge graphs based on entities and relations.

Parameters:

  • dtf – A pandas DataFrame containing entity-relation-object triples.

  • baseURL – The base URL for API requests.

plot_entity_based_graphs(word)

Plot a knowledge graph centered around a specific entity.

Parameters:

word – The entity to build the graph around.

plot_graph(entity)

Plot a knowledge graph centered around the specified entity.

Parameters:

entity – The central entity to build the graph around.

plot_topic_based_graphs(topic_words, entity_dict, max_graphs)

Plot knowledge graphs based on topic words and entity frequencies.

Parameters:

  • topic_words – A list of topic words.

  • entity_dict – A dictionary of entities and their frequencies.

  • max_graphs – The maximum number of graphs to plot.

saving_kg_as_json(entity)

Save a knowledge graph as JSON and send it via a POST request to the API.

Parameters:

entity – The entity for which the knowledge graph is saved.

class gen_kg.PDFExtractor(pdf_path)

Bases: object

Class for extracting text, sentences, metadata, and key-value pairs from a PDF document.

Parameters:

pdf_path – The path to the PDF document to extract information from.

extract_key_value_pairs()

Extract key-value pairs from tables in the PDF document.

Returns:

A list of dictionaries representing tables.

extract_metadata()

Extract metadata information from the PDF document and print it.

Returns:

None

extract_sentences()

Extract sentences from the PDF document.

Returns:

A list of sentences.

extract_text()

Extract text from the PDF document.

Returns:

The extracted text as a string.

class gen_kg.TextProcessor(sentences)

Bases: object

Class for processing text and extracting topics.

Parameters:

sentences – A list of sentences for text processing.

get_topics(num_topics=10)

Extract topics from the text using LDA. Using Perplexity score for finding the ideal number of topics. Perplexity score measures how well a probability distribution predicts a sample, often used in natural language processing with lower scores indicating better models. :param num_topics: The number of topics to extract, defaults to 10. :return: The LDA model, corpus, and id2word dictionary.

remove_stopwords(texts)

Remove stopwords from a list of words.

Parameters:

texts – A list of tokenized words.

Returns:

A list of words with stopwords removed.

replace_words_with_synonyms()

Replace words in the text with synonyms based on Word2Vec and K-means clustering. Used silhouette score for finding the ideal size of clusters. Silhouette score assesses the cohesion and separation of clusters in data, with higher scores indicating better-defined clusters in clustering analysis.

Returns:

The text with replaced synonyms.

sent_to_words(sentences)

Tokenize sentences into words and remove stopwords.

Parameters:

sentences – A list of sentences.

Returns:

A generator of tokenized words.

visualize_topics(topic_model, corpus, id2word)

Visualize topics using pyLDAvis.

Parameters:

  • topic_model – The LDA model.

  • corpus – The corpus of documents.

  • id2word – The dictionary of id to word mapping.

Returns:

Visualization data for topics.
